page.title: 12Customs of Christian Life
page.content: Christians are usually baptised as babies.The child has three godparents to help him live a good life until he is old enough to accept the faith himself.A priest uses Holy Water to make the sign of the cross on the child's forehead.When a teenager,the christian is confirmed and becomes a full member of the church. Christians marry in a religious ceremony.The bride wears a white dress and veil,and carries a bouquet of flowers.She usually has friends as bridesmaids who are also dressed in long pretty gowns.The bride and groom promise,in front of an altar,to stay together for life.The priest ties their hands together with his scarf, and the couple exchange rings. When they die,they are buried or cremated.Once again the priest is present to pray for them.
